ETH.name: Ethereum
ETH.what_it_is: Base layer blockchain. All DeFi protocols run on it. Gas fees are burned (deflationary when active).

on_chain_relevance.aave: ETH is the #1 collateral asset. High WETH utilization = high borrow demand (bullish demand signal) BUT also liquidation risk (bearish price pressure from forced sells).
on_chain_relevance.curve_3pool: Stablecoin stress = risk-off sentiment = bearish ETH. Balanced pool = stable market = neutral to bullish.
on_chain_relevance.uniswap: Direct price discovery. Liquidity depth shows conviction. LP range repositioning signals expected direction.
on_chain_relevance.ethena: USDe minting requires delta-neutral ETH positions. Rising USDe supply = more ETH being hedged = mixed signal.
on_chain_relevance.gas: Rising gas = more network activity = more ETH burned = bullish. Falling gas = quiet network = neutral.
on_chain_relevance.exchange_flows: ETH flowing TO exchanges = selling pressure. ETH leaving exchanges = accumulation.
on_chain_relevance.arb_bridge: ETH locked in Arbitrum bridge = ETH taken out of circulation = mildly bullish.

key_debate_angles: Is the current gas burn rate making ETH deflationary?
Are exchange reserves increasing (selling) or decreasing (holding)?
Is Aave liquidation risk a threat to ETH price?
What does stablecoin health tell us about market risk appetite?

AAVE.name: Aave
AAVE.what_it_is: Largest decentralized lending protocol. Revenue comes from interest rate spreads. AAVE token captures fees through governance.

on_chain_relevance.aave: THIS IS YOUR PROTOCOL. Utilization rate = direct revenue driver. High utilization = more fees BUT liquidation risk. Check each asset's utilization separately.
on_chain_relevance.curve_3pool: Stablecoin health directly affects Aave. If USDT depegs, Aave positions using USDT as collateral become risky. Pool imbalance = watch for bad debt.
on_chain_relevance.ethena: USDe is used as collateral on Aave. If USDe supply contracts, collateral leaves Aave = lower TVL = less revenue.
on_chain_relevance.exchange_flows: Large stablecoin inflows to exchanges could mean Aave depositors withdrawing to sell. Large outflows = fresh capital potentially entering Aave.
on_chain_relevance.gas: High gas makes Aave interactions expensive = fewer small liquidations get executed = liquidation risk compounds.

key_debate_angles: Is protocol revenue growing based on utilization and TVL trends?
Are we near a liquidation cascade that could cause bad debt?
How does stablecoin stability affect Aave's risk profile?
Are large wallets adding or removing collateral?

LINK.name: Chainlink
LINK.what_it_is: Decentralized oracle network. Provides price feeds to ALL DeFi protocols. Revenue from data feed subscriptions. LINK staking secures the network.

on_chain_relevance.aave: Aave DEPENDS on Chainlink oracles for all price feeds. More Aave activity = more oracle usage = bullish LINK. But Aave crisis could hurt confidence in oracle-dependent protocols.
on_chain_relevance.link_staking: THIS IS YOUR METRIC. Rising staking = confidence + supply reduction. Falling staking = potential sell pressure.
on_chain_relevance.curve_3pool: If stablecoins destabilize, oracle accuracy becomes critical. LINK benefits from being essential infrastructure during stress.
on_chain_relevance.exchange_flows: Large LINK transfers to exchanges = whale selling. From exchanges = accumulation.
on_chain_relevance.gas: Chainlink node operators pay gas to post price updates. Very high gas = oracle updates become expensive = potential delays.

key_debate_angles: Is LINK staking increasing (supply squeeze) or decreasing?
Does DeFi growth (Aave TVL, Uniswap volume) translate to oracle demand?
Are whales accumulating or distributing LINK?
Is LINK's role as critical infrastructure properly valued?

UNI.name: Uniswap
UNI.what_it_is: Largest decentralized exchange. Revenue from trading fees. UNI token governs fee switch and treasury. V3 concentrated liquidity.

on_chain_relevance.uniswap: THIS IS YOUR PROTOCOL. Liquidity depth, volume trends, and fee revenue are direct value drivers.
on_chain_relevance.aave: Aave liquidations generate Uniswap volume (liquidators swap collateral via DEXs). High Aave stress = spike in Uniswap volume = bullish UNI.
on_chain_relevance.curve_3pool: Curve and Uniswap compete for stablecoin volume. Curve stress could push volume to Uniswap.
on_chain_relevance.ethena: Ethena hedging requires DEX trading. More USDe minting = more hedging swaps = more Uniswap volume.
on_chain_relevance.exchange_flows: When CEX trust drops (exchange outflows), DEX volume rises. Bullish for UNI.

key_debate_angles: Is DEX volume trending up vs CEX volume?
How is concentrated liquidity positioned around current price?
Could DeFi stress (Aave liquidations) actually boost Uniswap revenue?
Is the fee switch narrative alive? Governance updates?

ENA.name: Ethena
ENA.what_it_is: Issues USDe (synthetic dollar) backed by delta-neutral ETH positions. Revenue from funding rate arbitrage. sUSDe = staked version earning yield.

on_chain_relevance.ethena: THIS IS YOUR PROTOCOL. USDe supply = direct demand metric. sUSDe staking ratio = yield demand. Supply growth = bullish. Contraction = bearish.
on_chain_relevance.aave: USDe is used as Aave collateral. If Aave utilization rises with USDe collateral, it validates ENA's product. If USDe gets flagged as risky collateral, bearish.
on_chain_relevance.curve_3pool: USDe must maintain its peg. Curve pool balance with USDe (if any) shows peg health. 3pool stress = general stablecoin anxiety = USDe confidence risk.
on_chain_relevance.exchange_flows: Stablecoin flows to exchanges could include USDe. Net stablecoin inflow = selling pressure on everything including ENA.

key_debate_angles: Is USDe supply growing or shrinking? What's the trend?
Is the sUSDe yield competitive? Are stakers staying?
Does funding rate environment support Ethena's delta-neutral strategy?
Is there any depeg risk based on on-chain data?

CRV.name: Curve
CRV.what_it_is: DEX optimized for stablecoin and pegged asset swaps. veCRV locking governs gauge rewards. Revenue from trading fees. Central to stablecoin infrastructure.

on_chain_relevance.curve_3pool: THIS IS YOUR PROTOCOL. 3pool balance IS your health metric. Balanced = healthy. Imbalanced = stress. Volume in 3pool = revenue.
on_chain_relevance.aave: Curve and Aave are deeply intertwined. crvUSD uses Aave-style lending. Aave stress can cascade into Curve pools.
on_chain_relevance.ethena: USDe pools on Curve provide liquidity for Ethena. If USDe grows, Curve benefits from more pool volume.
on_chain_relevance.exchange_flows: Stablecoin flows affect Curve directly. More stablecoins on-chain (not on exchanges) = more Curve volume potential.

key_debate_angles: Is the 3pool balanced? Any stablecoin showing stress?
Are gauge votes shifting? Which pools are attracting bribes?
Is Curve volume trending up or down?
How does veCRV locking affect circulating supply?

PENDLE.name: Pendle
PENDLE.what_it_is: Protocol for trading future yield. Splits yield-bearing assets into Principal Tokens (PT) and Yield Tokens (YT). Lets you go long/short on DeFi yields.

on_chain_relevance.aave: Aave supply rates directly affect Pendle yield markets. If Aave yields spike (high utilization), Pendle YT for Aave assets becomes more valuable.
on_chain_relevance.ethena: sUSDe yield is one of the most traded assets on Pendle. USDe supply/staking ratio changes directly impact Pendle's biggest market.
on_chain_relevance.curve_3pool: Stablecoin stress reduces yield farming confidence = less demand for yield trading = bearish Pendle.
on_chain_relevance.gas: High gas makes Pendle's yield trading expensive for smaller users.

key_debate_angles: Are DeFi yields rising or falling? (Check Aave rates, sUSDe yield)
Is yield trading volume on Pendle growing?
What does the PT discount tell us about market's yield expectations?
Is Pendle's TVL growing = more demand for yield trading?

ZRO.name: LayerZero
ZRO.what_it_is: Omnichain messaging protocol. Connects 50+ blockchains. Revenue from message fees. ZRO token used for gas on cross-chain transactions.

on_chain_relevance.arb_bridge: Competing/complementary signal. If Arbitrum bridge activity rises, cross-chain activity is growing = bullish ZRO. But native bridges competing with LayerZero = mixed.
on_chain_relevance.exchange_flows: Cross-chain capital movement visible from our ETH node. More bridging activity = more LayerZero usage potential.
on_chain_relevance.gas: LayerZero messages originate on ETH L1. High gas = expensive to send cross-chain messages = friction.
on_chain_relevance.ethena: Ethena is multichain. USDe bridging uses messaging protocols. More USDe cross-chain = more LayerZero messages.

key_debate_angles: Is cross-chain messaging volume increasing?
Are major protocols integrating LayerZero for new chains?
How does bridge volume trend correlate with ZRO price?
Is L2 growth (ARB bridge activity) driving cross-chain demand?

ARB.name: Arbitrum
ARB.what_it_is: Largest Ethereum L2 by TVL. Scales ETH with lower fees. ARB token governs treasury and protocol incentives. Revenue from sequencer fees.

on_chain_relevance.arb_bridge: THIS IS YOUR METRIC. ETH locked in bridge = capital committed to Arbitrum. Rising = growth. Falling = capital flight.
on_chain_relevance.aave: Aave is deployed on Arbitrum. L1 Aave stress could push users to cheaper Arbitrum Aave = bullish ARB.
on_chain_relevance.uniswap: Uniswap on Arbitrum = growing DEX volume on L2 = bullish ARB ecosystem.
on_chain_relevance.gas: High L1 gas = users migrate to L2 = bullish ARB. Low L1 gas = less incentive for L2 = bearish ARB.
on_chain_relevance.exchange_flows: Stablecoins bridging TO Arbitrum = ecosystem growth. Bridging back to L1 = capital leaving.

key_debate_angles: Is ETH locked in the bridge growing or shrinking?
Does high L1 gas drive users to Arbitrum?
Is Arbitrum DeFi TVL growing relative to other L2s?
Are sequencer revenues trending up = real usage growth?

LDO.what_it_is: Lido DAO - Largest ETH liquid staking protocol. Controls ~30% of all staked ETH. LDO is the governance token.
LDO.on_chain_relevance: Directly tied to ETH staking ecosystem. Aave utilization affects stETH demand. Exchange ETH reserves impact staking flows. Gas trends reflect network activity which drives staking yield.
key_debate_angles: ETH staking yield vs DeFi yields — when Aave rates are high, capital may flow from staking to lending
stETH/ETH peg stability — Curve 3pool stress can indicate broader DeFi stress affecting Lido
Whale ETH movements to/from exchanges impact staking demand — outflows bullish for LDO
Regulatory risk around liquid staking derivatives — SEC scrutiny on staking services
